channel.title: Notepad +
channel.description: is there a way to set the default file format to java?

item.title: Notepad +
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:8, topic:436885”]I’m bad at programming, I’ve always used notepad and I don’t use an IDE, thats possibly worse than being reliant on an IDE…[/quote]i couldn’t live without syntax highlighting

Read full topic

item.title: Notepad +
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Settings -> Preferences ->New Document/Default directory -> Default language: Java

PS. I suggest you search around before you ask questions, it helps to be self dependant.

Read full topic

item.title: Notepad +
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote="_s, post:5, topic:436885"][quote author=Native^ link=topic=539601.msg3949724#msg3949724 date=1332193414]

[quote author=_s link=topic=539601.msg3949592#msg3949592 date=1332187947]

notepad ++? are you stupid?? use an ide.
[/quote]nothing wrong with text editors?

bleh, not if you’re a newbie to java and need to compile the source code every time again

btw: i use gedit myself, just not for java, so yeah, there’s nothing wrong with text editors.
[/quote]newbies using ides makes them overly reliant upon the ide.[/quote]
This.

Read full topic
